hanzi-su-wiki:
韓

Значения

Корея, корейский

Мнемоника

Слева — трава 十 (сокращено 艹) и раннее утро 早 в значении туман. Стелящийся 韋 утренний туман. Образное название древнего княжества в провинции Хэнань, а также Кореи.

Варианты

韩
purpleculture_pinyin:
hán
Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 战国七雄 ; Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897; Korea, esp. South Korea 大韩民国 ; surname Han
Хан, один из Семи Государств-героев Воюющих Государств 战国 七雄; Корея после падения династии Чосон в 1897 году; Корея, особенно Южная Корея 大韩民国; фамилия Хан
rtega_mnemonic:
韓韓RS
韩韩		fence, Korea
  • place where the sun is strong 龺 and fenced so you have to walk around it 韋/韦
purpleculture_examples:
韓國 [ hán guó ]: South Korea (Republic of Korea); Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 战国七雄 ; Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897
韓世昌 [ hán shì chāng ]: Han Shichang (1897-1977), actor specializing in Kunqu opera 昆曲
韓亞 [ hán yà ]: Hanya; Hana
韓信 [ hán xìn ]: Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 刘邦
韓元 [ hán yuán ]: Won (Korean currency)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 龺 [ gān ] sunlight; the rays of the sun
    • 韋 [ wéi ] tanned leather; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: There's a young Korean male actor, Yon-sama, famous amongst middle-aged Japanese women. Extremely famous. Read about his affect on Japan/Korean relations on Everything2.com. In any case, women just flipped over this guy, traveled to Korea to see his home, started taking Korean language classes, etc. So, imagine here the misty eyes of the Japanese women as they clutch their lockets with Yon-sama's picture inside watching his Korean romantic mini series called "Winter Sonata".
heisig_constituent: korea, mist, ten, needle, early, sun, day, locket, stick, key, mouth, monocle, sunglasses with one lens missing, ten2, needle2
heisig_story: As with Italy (Frame 1245) and Africa (Frame 1391), this character simply abbreviates the full name of Korea. Its elements: mist . . . locket.
koohiiStory1: There´s a young Korean male actor, Yon-sama, famous amongst middle-aged Japanese women. Extremely famous. Read about his affect on Japan/Korean relations on Everything2.com. In any case, women just flipped over this guy, traveled to Korea to see his home, started taking Korean language classes, etc. So, imagine here the misty eyes of the Japanese women as they clutch their lockets with Yon-sama´s picture inside watching his Korean romantic mini series called "Winter Sonata".
koohiiStory2: This character represents the flag of South Korea: a locket (circular taegeuk) in the middle of the mist (white background). http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_South_Korea.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: In the morning, Korea will still be Korea.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture Korea first thing in the morning. You can see all the cities, the countryside, everything waking up.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Korea is still here today on this beautiful morning because of Genghis Khan (かん). When he was conquering all that land in Asia and Europe he looked at Korea in the morning light and said, "Nah, they can keep it."
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Genghis Khan admiring Korea from afar, but letting it live on.
Ru_AutoNotes: И кандзи 韓, и 朝 связаны с Кореей. Слова <ruby>韓国<rt>かんごく</rt></ruby> и <ruby>朝鮮<rt>ちょうせん</rt></ruby> оба значат "Корея", но первым сейчас называют Южную, а вторым чаще Северную (<ruby>北朝鮮<rt>きたちょうせん</rt></ruby>, хотя допустимо и <ruby>南朝鮮<rt>みなみちょうせん</rt></ruby>).
Ru_Words:

  • (Южная) Корея
    • jr-edict

  • ист. кореец, кореянка

    韓から
  • ист. Китай, реже также Корея или др. зарубежные страны
Ru_Radicals: 十 (десять), 口 (рот), 日 (день), 韋 (дублёная кожа)
Ru_trainchinese: hán: (сущ) Хань (одно из Воюющих царств в древнем Китае); Южная Корея
Kanshudo_mnemonic: they make tanned leather (韋) ten times earlier (𠦝) in Korea
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When Chinese girls fall in love with a Korean pop singer they do weird stuff like make a briar patch and cut the word Korea into it. They'll even buy a fog machine to make some mist making it look more awesome.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze uses "倝" as " Han ", see "倝". In the Warring States period, Qin characters first saw " 𩏑 ", starting from " Wei " and "倝". It is also saved as " Han ", which is the original version of the script. "Said Wen" is based on the original meaning of Jingyuan. "Said Wen": "𩏑, Jing Yuan. From Wei, take the 帀帀. The sound."

" Han " was a vassal state enfeoffed in the Zhou Dynasty and was later destroyed by the Jin Dynasty. "poetry. Daya. "Han Yi Xu": ""Han Yi", Yin Jifu, King Mei Xuan." Mao Chuan: "Han, the country of the surname Ji. Later it was destroyed by the Jin Dynasty, so the doctor Han thought the town was named Yan."

At the end of the Spring and Autumn Period, Han, Zhao, and Wei divided into three divisions. South Korea later became one of the Seven Heroes of the Warring States Period and was eventually destroyed by Qin. "Warring. "Han Ceyi": "There are Gong, Luo, and Chenggao in North Korea, Yiyang and Changhan Fortress in the west, Wan, Rang, and Weishui in the east, and Xingshan Mountain in the south, with thousands of miles and hundreds of thousands of armors. ""Historical Records. "Qin Benji": "Twenty-four years, Jin chaos, killed Zhibo, and divided his country with Zhao, Han, and Wei."

" Han " is also a surname, such as Han Fei, a representative of the Legalist in the last years of the Warring States Period, Han Xin, a Hou Huaiyin in the early Western Han Dynasty, Han Yu, a writer in the Tang Dynasty, and Han Shizhong, a general in the Southern Song Dynasty.
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze text uses "倝" as " Kan ". In the Warring States period, Qin characters first saw " 𩏑 ", starting from " Wei " and "倝". It is also saved as " Han ", which is the original version of the script. "Said Wen" is based on the original meaning of Jingyuan.
humanum_full_description:
金文以「倝」為「韓」，參見「倝」。戰國秦系文字始見「𩏑」，從「韋」，「倝」聲。又省為「韓」，為楷本所本。《說文》以為本義是井垣。《說文》：「𩏑，井垣也。从韋，取其帀也。倝聲。」

　　「韓」是周代分封的諸侯國，後為晉所滅。《詩．大雅．韓奕序》：「〈韓奕〉，尹吉甫美宣王也。」毛傳：「韓，姬姓之國也。後為晉所滅，故大夫韓氏以為邑名焉。」

　　春秋末年，韓、趙、魏三分晉室。韓國後來成為戰國七雄之一，最終被秦國所滅。《戰國策．韓策一》：「韓北有鞏、洛、成皋之固，西有宜陽、常阪之塞，東有宛、穰、洧水，南有陘山，地方千里，帶甲數十萬。」《史記．秦本紀》：「二十四年，晉亂，殺智伯，分其國與趙、韓、魏。」

　　「韓」也是姓氏，如戰國末年的法家代表韓非、西漢初年淮陰侯韓信、唐代文學家韓愈、南宋將領韓世忠等。
humanum_short_description: 金文以「倝」為「韓」。戰國秦系文字始見「𩏑」，從「韋」，「倝」聲。又省為「韓」，為楷本所本。《說文》以為本義是井垣。

韓字的基本解释

韓
hán
见“韩”。

韓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［hán］
［《廣韻》胡安切，平寒，匣。］
“幹3”的被通假字。“韩1”的繁体字。
(1)古国名。公元前十一世纪周分封的同姓诸侯国。其地在今山西河津东北。西周、春秋间为晋所灭。
(2)古国名。战国七雄之一。开国君主韩虔侯与魏文侯、赵烈侯本为晋卿，后瓜分晋国。公元前403年初周威烈王承认为诸侯，前230年为秦所灭。疆域约当今山西省东南角和河南省中部，介于魏、秦、楚三国之间，是古代兵家必争之地。
(3)1897－1910年朝鲜的国名。1897年，李氏朝鲜国王高宗李熙（1863－1910年在位）改国名为“大韩”。建元光武。1910年为日本吞并。第二次世界大战后，朝鲜南半部称大韩民国。
(4)姓。

韓字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【韋字部】　韓； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1394第20
【唐韻】【集韻】胡安切【韻會】【正韻】河干切，?音寒。【說文】井垣也。从韋，取其帀也。幹聲。　又國名。【詩·大雅·韓奕箋】韓，姬姓之國也，後爲晉所滅，故大夫韓氏以爲邑名。【左傳·桓三年】韓萬御戎。【韻會】曲沃桓公之子萬，食邑于韓，後分晉爲國。　又三韓，國名，辰韓，弁韓，馬韓也。見【後漢·東夷傳】。　又【廣韻】姓也。【韻會】秦滅韓，以國爲氏。　又叶胡千切，音焉。【孫楚·白起贊】神機電斷，氣齊卒然，南折勁楚，走魏禽韓。　【說文】本作?。【集韻】亦作榦幹。

考證：〔又三韓，國名，辰韓，示韓，馬韓也。見【後漢·光武紀】。〕　謹按示韓當作弁韓，見後漢書東夷傳，光武紀本文無之。謹將示改爲弁。光武紀改東夷傳。
韓字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
韓字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Korean
hán
See "Han".
Korean
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [hán]
["Guangyun" Juanqie, Ping Han, Xia. ]
"Do 3" was passed falsely. Traditional characters for "韩1".
(1) Ancient country name. In the 11th century BC, it was a state of the same surname. Its place is in the northeast of Hejin, Shanxi today. During the Western Zhou Dynasty and Spring and Autumn Period, it was destroyed by the Jin Dynasty.
(2) Ancient country name. One of the Seven Heroes of the Warring States Period. The founding monarch Han Qianhou, Wei Wenhou, and Zhao Liehou were originally Jin Qing, and later divided the Jin kingdom. At the beginning of 403 BC, King Zhou Weilie was recognized as a vassal, and was destroyed by Qin in 230 BC. The territory is about the southeast corner of Shanxi Province and the central part of Henan Province, between the Wei, Qin, and Chu kingdoms. It was a battleground for ancient military strategists.
(3) The name of North Korea from 1897 to 1910. In 1897, King Gojong Lee Hee (reigned from 1863 to 1910) of the Korean King of the Lee clan changed his country's name to "Daehan". Jianyuan Guangwu. It was annexed by Japan in 1910. After the Second World War, the southern half of North Korea was called the Republic of Korea.
(4) Last name.
Korean

[Rhyme Club] Wan, son of Lord Quwohuan, lived in Korea, and was later divided into the kingdom.　Three Koreas, the name of the country, Chenhan, Benhan, Mahanye. See 【The Legend of Later Han·Dongyi】.　[Guangyun] The last name is also. [Rhyme Club] Qin destroys Han and regards the country as his clan.　 Ye Hu Qianqi again, Yin Yan. [Sun Chu·Bai Qi Zan] The gods are cut off, the spirit is stunned, and the south is rushed to the south to go to Wei Qin Han.　【Said the text】This work?. [Jiyun] also do the work. Textual research: [You San Han, the name of the country, Chen Han, Shi Han, Ma Han Ye. See [Later Han·Guangwu Ji]. 〕 　 I would like to refer to Shihan as Bianhan, see Dongyi Chuan in the Later Han Dynasty, Guangwu Ji has nothing in this article. I would like to change the indication to 弁. Guangwu Ji changed Dongyi Chuan.

Name meaning

hán
вм. 韩
Radicals: 韋  (korea, morning)
Meaning Mnemonic
In the morning, Korea will still be Korea.
Picture Korea first thing in the morning. You can see all the cities, the countryside, everything waking up.
Reading Mnemonic
Korea is still here today on this beautiful morning because of Genghis Khan (かん). When he was conquering all that land in Asia and Europe he looked at Korea in the morning light and said, "Nah, they can keep it."
Picture Genghis Khan admiring Korea from afar, but letting it live on.

十 (десять), 口 (рот), 日 (день), 韋 (дублёная кожа)
И кандзи 韓, и 朝 связаны с Кореей. Слова 韓国かんごく и 朝鮮ちょうせん оба значат "Корея", но первым сейчас называют Южную, а вторым чаще Северную (北朝鮮きたちょうせん, хотя допустимо и 南朝鮮みなみちょうせん).
